snippet: Analysts welcomed the announcements, which signaled progress in a far-ranging plan of overhauls designed to modernize the country’s financial system.
abstract: Head of China’s central bank and other top financial regulators offer new details on country’s steps toward a more market-driven economy, including plans to liberalize interest rates and to allow first privately owned official banks; analysts welcome announcements, which signal progress in overhauls designed to modernize China's financial system.

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Analysts welcomed the announcements, which signaled progress in a far-ranging plan of overhauls designed to modernize the country’s financial system.

headline.main: China Details Plans to Liberalize Interest Rates and Encourage Private Banks
headline.print_headline: China Says It Plans to End Controls on Interest Rates and Private Banks
